question: As per the NSO’s first advanced estimates, what would be the GDP growth/contraction in India, in FY 2020-21?
explanation:
As per the first advanced estimates of the national income released by the National Statistical Office (NSO), India’s real Gross Domestic Product (GDP) in FY 2020-21 is estimated to contract by 7.7%.
This is against the growth rate of 4.2% in the fiscal year 2019-20. There is an estimated contraction in all sectors except the agriculture in the current fiscal. While manufacturing sector is likely contract by 9.4%, Agriculture sector is estimated to grow by 3.4% compared to the last year.
